author: bampakoa
message:
docs: Typos fixes in built-in directives guide (#38520)

PR Close #38520

files.patch:
@@ -194,7 +194,7 @@ which explains the following: * Using [``](guide/structural-directives#ngcontainer "") to group elements when there is no suitable host element for the directive. * How to write your own structural directive. -* That you can only apply [one structural directive](guide/structural-directives#one-per-element "one per host element") to an element. +* Why you [can only apply one structural directive](guide/structural-directives#one-per-element "one per host element") to an element. @@ -281,7 +281,7 @@ You define a block of HTML that defines how a single item should be displayed and then you tell Angular to use that block as a template for rendering each item in the list. The text assigned to `*ngFor` is the instruction that guides the repeater process. -The following example shows `NgFor` applied to a simple `
`. (Don't forget the asterisk (`*`) in front of `ngFor`.) +The following example shows `NgFor` applied to a simple `
`.
